text: Cornelia "Nellie" Cole Fairbanks (January 14, 1852 â€“ October 24, 1913) was the second lady of the United States from 1905 to 1909 as the wife of the 26th vice president of the United States, Charles W. Fairbanks. She was born in 1852 and attended Ohio Wesleyan University. She got married in 1874 to Charles W. Fairbanks and had five children. She died in 1913. == References == Category:1852 births Category:1913 deaths Category:People from Ohio Category:Second Ladies of the United States
title: Cornelia Cole Fairbanks
